- The purpose of a Strategic Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to deliver the business and IT strategy of an enterprise
- The purpose of a Strategic Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to deliver the business and IT strategy of an enterprise_2
- The purpose of gap analysis is to inform stakeholders regarding the extent of change that is required to move EA artifacts such as Services, Business Processes and Applications for the specified EA layer from a baseline state to a target state
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy. The roadmap outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progress towards target architecture.

- The purpose of the Application Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Application Service Stakeholder Model is to inform stakeholders of the different roles (internal and external) that will interact with a given application service
- The purpose of the Business Function/Service Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Service Catalogue of an enterprise, the degree of automation of each function/service, and the roles (people) required to perform the function/service
- The purpose of the Business Information Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Data Subject classes that the enterprise must manage through its life-cycle
- The purpose of the Business Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing key business elements that will exist at this stage of the Business Roadmap
- The purpose of the Business Performance Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the performance accountability in an enterprise and the line of sight of an enterprise towards government strategic outcomes
- The purpose of the Business Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to business ekements of the enterprise that are to be undertaken to deliver the business strategy
- The purpose of the Data Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Information/Data elements that will exist at this stage of the Data Roadmap
- The purpose of the Data Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Data Security Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the security and responsibilities of the data assets in a department in order to improve data accountability
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between Data Subjects and applications in an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between logical Data Objects and application services in use across an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Information Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the information assets of an enterprise in a consistent manner that will enable re-use and information sharing
- The purpose of the Organisation Structure Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the accountability and responsibility towards the services that are routinely rendered by an enterprise â€“ be it an internal service or external service; and the business footprint to inform capacity and network design

- The purpose of the Service Dependency Model is to illustrate the dependencies that exist for a given Service
- The purpose of the Strategic Goals Model is to provide stakeholders with a line of sight from high level strategic business goals, through objectives and the drivers that motivate them
- The purpose of the Technology Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Technology elements that will exist at this stage of the Technology Roadmap
- The purpose of the Technology Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis

- It is a model that defines a portfolio of applications and its service/function decomposition
- It is a model that defines the Core and Support Functions/Services of the Enterprise, the Information Systems that enable the function/service, and the roles of the actors that participate
- It is a model that defines the Technologies in relation to the different subsystems in a distributed computing or client-server configuration (Note: Also known as the â€œtechnology stackâ€ of a specific system)
- It is a model that defines the applications, their locations and the interfaces between applications
- It is a model that defines the business processes of the enterprise, in the form of events, activities, rules and responsibilities
- It is a model that defines the defines the technologies in different locations/environments
- It is a model that defines the information assets that are consumed and produced by each Business Function/Service, including information exchange requirements with external business functions/services
- It is a model that defines the interaction (e.g. create, read, update, delete) between applications and data
- It is a model that defines the organisational structure (hierarchical decomposition), the functions/service performed by each organisational unit, the geographic location where these organisation unit reside, and the responsible authority (owner) of these organisation units
- It is a model that defines the relationships between objectives / imperatives as derived from Policy, Act, Regulation and requirements, and the responsible organisation to achieve the objectives, and the measures or key performance indicators (KPI) by which to measure achievements of such objectives
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Objects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Subjects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Business Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Data Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from a baseline to a target architecture state
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Application Architecture to the Target Application Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Data Architecture to the Target Data Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Technology Architecture to the Target Technology Architecture
- It provides a model that defines the major classes of technology components/services (infrastructure software, hardware, and network) and the interoperability standards associated thereto

- The purpose of gap analysis is to inform stakeholders regarding the extent of change that is required to move EA artifacts such as Services, Business Processes and Applications for the specified EA layer from a baseline state to a target state
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy. The roadmap outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progress towards target architecture.

- The purpose of the Application Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Application elements that will exist at this stage of the Application Roadmap
- The purpose of the Application Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the major classes of applications that are needed to automate or enable the functions/services of
- The purpose of the Application Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Application Service Stakeholder Model is to inform stakeholders of the different roles (internal and external) that will interact with a given application service
- The purpose of the Business Function/Service Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Service Catalogue of an enterprise, the degree of automation of each function/service, and the roles (people) required to perform the function/service
- The purpose of the Business Information Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Data Subject classes that the enterprise must manage through its life-cycle
- The purpose of the Business Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing key business elements that will exist at this stage of the Business Roadmap
- The purpose of the Business Performance Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the performance accountability in an enterprise and the line of sight of an enterprise towards government strategic outcomes
- The purpose of the Business Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to business ekements of the enterprise that are to be undertaken to deliver the business strategy
- The purpose of the Data Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Information/Data elements that will exist at this stage of the Data Roadmap
- The purpose of the Data Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Data Security Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the security and responsibilities of the data assets in a department in order to improve data accountability
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between Data Subjects and applications in an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between logical Data Objects and application services in use across an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Information Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the information assets of an enterprise in a consistent manner that will enable re-use and information sharing
- The purpose of the Organisation Structure Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the accountability and responsibility towards the services that are routinely rendered by an enterprise â€“ be it an internal service or external service; and the business footprint to inform capacity and network design
- The purpose of the Project Dependency Model is to illustrate the dependencies that exist for a given Project.
- The purpose of the Service Dependency Model is to illustrate the dependencies that exist for a given Service
- The purpose of the Strategic Goals Model is to provide stakeholders with a line of sight from high level strategic business goals, through objectives and the drivers that motivate them
- The purpose of the Technology Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Technology elements that will exist at this stage of the Technology Roadmap
- The purpose of the Technology Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis

- It is a model that defines a portfolio of applications and its service/function decomposition
- It is a model that defines the Core and Support Functions/Services of the Enterprise, the Information Systems that enable the function/service, and the roles of the actors that participate
- It is a model that defines the Technologies in relation to the different subsystems in a distributed computing or client-server configuration (Note: Also known as the â€œtechnology stackâ€ of a specific system)
- It is a model that defines the applications, their locations and the interfaces between applications
- It is a model that defines the business processes of the enterprise, in the form of events, activities, rules and responsibilities
- It is a model that defines the defines the technologies in different locations/environments
- It is a model that defines the information assets that are consumed and produced by each Business Function/Service, including information exchange requirements with external business functions/services
- It is a model that defines the interaction (e.g. create, read, update, delete) between applications and data
- It is a model that defines the organisational structure (hierarchical decomposition), the functions/service performed by each organisational unit, the geographic location where these organisation unit reside, and the responsible authority (owner) of these organisation units
- It is a model that defines the relationships between objectives / imperatives as derived from Policy, Act, Regulation and requirements, and the responsible organisation to achieve the objectives, and the measures or key performance indicators (KPI) by which to measure achievements of such objectives
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Objects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Subjects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Business Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Data Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from a baseline to a target architecture state
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Application Architecture to the Target Application Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Data Architecture to the Target Data Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Technology Architecture to the Target Technology Architecture
- It provides a model that defines the major classes of technology components/services (infrastructure software, hardware, and network) and the interoperability standards associated thereto

- The purpose of a Strategic Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to deliver the business and IT strategy of an enterprise
- The purpose of the
- The purpose of the Application Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Application elements that will exist at this stage of the Application Roadmap
- The purpose of the Application Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the major classes of applications that are needed to automate or enable the functions/services of
- The purpose of the Application Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Application Service Stakeholder Model is to inform stakeholders of the different roles (internal and external) that will interact with a given application service
- The purpose of the Business Function/Service Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Service Catalogue of an enterprise, the degree of automation of each function/service, and the roles (people) required to perform the function/service
- The purpose of the Business Information Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Data Subject classes that the enterprise must manage through its life-cycle
- The purpose of the Business Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing key business elements that will exist at this stage of the Business Roadmap
- The purpose of the Business Performance Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the performance accountability in an enterprise and the line of sight of an enterprise towards government strategic outcomes
- The purpose of the Business Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to business elements of the enterprise that are to be undertaken to deliver the business strategy
- The purpose of the Data Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Information/Data elements that will exist at this stage of the Data Roadmap
- The purpose of the Data Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Data Security Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the security and responsibilities of the data assets in a department in order to improve data accountability
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between Data Subjects and applications in an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between logical Data Objects and application services in use across an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Information Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the information assets of an enterprise in a consistent manner that will enable re-use and information sharing
- The purpose of the Organisation Structure Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the accountability and responsibility towards the services that are routinely rendered by an enterprise â€“ be it an internal service or external service; and the business footprint to inform capacity and network design
- The purpose of the Strategic Goals Model is to provide stakeholders with a line of sight from high level strategic business goals, through objectives and the drivers that motivate them

- The purpose of a Strategic Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to deliver the business and IT strategy of an enterprise
- The purpose of a Strategic Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to deliver the business and IT strategy of an enterprise_2
- The purpose of gap analysis is to inform stakeholders regarding the extent of change that is required to move EA artifacts such as Services, Business Processes and Applications for the specified EA layer from a baseline state to a target state
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy. The roadmap outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progress towards target architecture.

- The purpose of the Application Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Application elements that will exist at this stage of the Application Roadmap
- The purpose of the Application Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the major classes of applications that are needed to automate or enable the functions/services of
- The purpose of the Application Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Application Service Stakeholder Model is to inform stakeholders of the different roles (internal and external) that will interact with a given application service
- The purpose of the Business Function/Service Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Service Catalogue of an enterprise, the degree of automation of each function/service, and the roles (people) required to perform the function/service
- The purpose of the Business Information Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Data Subject classes that the enterprise must manage through its life-cycle
- The purpose of the Business Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing key business elements that will exist at this stage of the Business Roadmap
- The purpose of the Business Performance Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the performance accountability in an enterprise and the line of sight of an enterprise towards government strategic outcomes
- The purpose of the Business Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to business ekements of the enterprise that are to be undertaken to deliver the business strategy
- The purpose of the Data Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Information/Data elements that will exist at this stage of the Data Roadmap
- The purpose of the Data Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Data Security Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the security and responsibilities of the data assets in a department in order to improve data accountability
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between Data Subjects and applications in an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Information Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the information assets of an enterprise in a consistent manner that will enable re-use and information sharing
- The purpose of the Organisation Structure Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the accountability and responsibility towards the services that are routinely rendered by an enterprise â€“ be it an internal service or external service; and the business footprint to inform capacity and network design
- The purpose of the Project Dependency Model is to illustrate the dependencies that exist for a given Project.
- The purpose of the Service Dependency Model is to illustrate the dependencies that exist for a given Service
- The purpose of the Strategic Goals Model is to provide stakeholders with a line of sight from high level strategic business goals, through objectives and the drivers that motivate them
- The purpose of the Technology Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Technology elements that will exist at this stage of the Technology Roadmap
- The purpose of the Technology Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis

- It is a model that defines a portfolio of applications and its service/function decomposition
- It is a model that defines the Core and Support Functions/Services of the Enterprise, the Information Systems that enable the function/service, and the roles of the actors that participate
- It is a model that defines the Technologies in relation to the different subsystems in a distributed computing or client-server configuration (Note: Also known as the â€œtechnology stackâ€ of a specific system)
- It is a model that defines the applications, their locations and the interfaces between applications
- It is a model that defines the business processes of the enterprise, in the form of events, activities, rules and responsibilities
- It is a model that defines the defines the technologies in different locations/environments
- It is a model that defines the information assets that are consumed and produced by each Business Function/Service, including information exchange requirements with external business functions/services
- It is a model that defines the interaction (e.g. create, read, update, delete) between applications and data
- It is a model that defines the organisational structure (hierarchical decomposition), the functions/service performed by each organisational unit, the geographic location where these organisation unit reside, and the responsible authority (owner) of these organisation units
- It is a model that defines the relationships between objectives / imperatives as derived from Policy, Act, Regulation and requirements, and the responsible organisation to achieve the objectives, and the measures or key performance indicators (KPI) by which to measure achievements of such objectives
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Objects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Subjects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Business Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Data Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from a baseline to a target architecture state
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Application Architecture to the Target Application Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Data Architecture to the Target Data Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Technology Architecture to the Target Technology Architecture
- It provides a model that defines the major classes of technology components/services (infrastructure software, hardware, and network) and the interoperability standards associated thereto

- The purpose of a Strategic Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to deliver the business and IT strategy of an enterprise
- The purpose of gap analysis is to inform stakeholders regarding the extent of change that is required to move EA artifacts such as Services, Business Processes and Applications for the specified EA layer from a baseline state to a target state
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy
- The purpose of the
- The purpose of the Application Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Application elements that will exist at this stage of the Application Roadmap
- The purpose of the Application Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the major classes of applications that are needed to automate or enable the functions/services of
- The purpose of the Application Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Application Service Stakeholder Model is to inform stakeholders of the different roles (internal and external) that will interact with a given application service
- The purpose of the Business Function/Service Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Service Catalogue of an enterprise, the degree of automation of each function/service, and the roles (people) required to perform the function/service
- The purpose of the Business Information Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Data Subject classes that the enterprise must manage through its life-cycle
- The purpose of the Business Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing key business elements that will exist at this stage of the Business Roadmap
- The purpose of the Business Performance Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the performance accountability in an enterprise and the line of sight of an enterprise towards government strategic outcomes
- The purpose of the Business Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to business ekements of the enterprise that are to be undertaken to deliver the business strategy
- The purpose of the Data Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Information/Data elements that will exist at this stage of the Data Roadmap
- The purpose of the Data Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Data Security Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the security and responsibilities of the data assets in a department in order to improve data accountability
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between Data Subjects and applications in an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between logical Data Objects and application services in use across an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Information Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the information assets of an enterprise in a consistent manner that will enable re-use and information sharing
- The purpose of the Organisation Structure Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the accountability and responsibility towards the services that are routinely rendered by an enterprise â€“ be it an internal service or external service; and the business footprint to inform capacity and network design
- The purpose of the Project Dependency Model is to illustrate the dependencies that exist for a given Project.
- The purpose of the Service Dependency Model is to illustrate the dependencies that exist for a given Service
- The purpose of the Strategic Goals Model is to provide stakeholders with a line of sight from high level strategic business goals, through objectives and the drivers that motivate them
- The purpose of the Technology Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Technology elements that will exist at this stage of the Technology Roadmap
- The purpose of the Technology Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of this view is to define the distribution of technology components for a distributed operating environment that will reduce duplication and optimise the re-use of shared infrastructure whilst providing optimal access channels to information intensive services to the intended users
- The purpose of this view is to describe the direct data related dependencies that exist for the
- The purpose of this view is to describe the flow of steps and participants (users and systems) in the
- The purpose of this view is to inform stakeholders on how applications or application components are distributed across the footprint of the organisation and how they interface or integrate with each other and the environment
- The purpose of this view is to inform stakeholders regarding the redundancies and deficiencies of technology in an enterprise
- The purpose of this view is to inform stakeholders regarding the workflow (and information flow) that is needed to produce a product or render a service.

- It is a model that defines a portfolio of applications and its service/function decomposition
- It is a model that defines the Core and Support Functions/Services of the Enterprise, the Information Systems that enable the function/service, and the roles of the actors that participate
- It is a model that defines the Technologies in relation to the different subsystems in a distributed computing or client-server configuration (Note: Also known as the â€œtechnology stackâ€ of a specific system)
- It is a model that defines the applications, their locations and the interfaces between applications
- It is a model that defines the business processes of the enterprise, in the form of events, activities, rules and responsibilities
- It is a model that defines the defines the technologies in different locations/environments
- It is a model that defines the information assets that are consumed and produced by each Business Function/Service, including information exchange requirements with external business functions/services
- It is a model that defines the interaction (e.g. create, read, update, delete) between applications and data
- It is a model that defines the organisational structure (hierarchical decomposition), the functions/service performed by each organisational unit, the geographic location where these organisation unit reside, and the responsible authority (owner) of these organisation units
- It is a model that defines the relationships between objectives / imperatives as derived from Policy, Act, Regulation and requirements, and the responsible organisation to achieve the objectives, and the measures or key performance indicators (KPI) by which to measure achievements of such objectives
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Objects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Subjects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Business Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Data Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from a baseline to a target architecture state
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Application Architecture to the Target Application Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Data Architecture to the Target Data Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Technology Architecture to the Target Technology Architecture
- It provides a model that defines the major classes of technology components/services (infrastructure software, hardware, and network) and the interoperability standards associated thereto

- The purpose of gap analysis is to inform stakeholders regarding the extent of change that is required to move EA artifacts such as Services, Business Processes and Applications for the specified EA layer from a baseline state to a target state
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy

- The purpose of the Application Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Application Service Stakeholder Model is to inform stakeholders of the different roles (internal and external) that will interact with a given application service
- The purpose of the Business Function/Service Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Service Catalogue of an enterprise, the degree of automation of each function/service, and the roles (people) required to perform the function/service

- The purpose of the Business Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to business ekements of the enterprise that are to be undertaken to deliver the business strategy
- The purpose of the Data Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Information/Data elements that will exist at this stage of the Data Roadmap

- It is a model that defines the Core and Support Functions/Services of the Enterprise, the Information Systems that enable the function/service, and the roles of the actors that participate
- It is a model that defines the Technologies in relation to the different subsystems in a distributed computing or client-server configuration (Note: Also known as the â€œtechnology stackâ€ of a specific system)
- It is a model that defines the applications, their locations and the interfaces between applications
- It is a model that defines the business processes of the enterprise, in the form of events, activities, rules and responsibilities
- It is a model that defines the defines the technologies in different locations/environments
- It is a model that defines the information assets that are consumed and produced by each Business Function/Service, including information exchange requirements with external business functions/services
- It is a model that defines the interaction (e.g. create, read, update, delete) between applications and data
- It is a model that defines the organisational structure (hierarchical decomposition), the functions/service performed by each organisational unit, the geographic location where these organisation unit reside, and the responsible authority (owner) of these organisation units

- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Subjects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto

- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Data Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models

- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Data Architecture to the Target Data Architecture

- It is a model that defines a portfolio of applications and its service/function decomposition
- It is a model that defines the Core and Support Functions/Services of the Enterprise, the Information Systems that enable the function/service, and the roles of the actors that participate
- It is a model that defines the Technologies in relation to the different subsystems in a distributed computing or client-server configuration (Note: Also known as the â€œtechnology stackâ€ of a specific system)
- It is a model that defines the applications, their locations and the interfaces between applications
- It is a model that defines the business processes of the enterprise, in the form of events, activities, rules and responsibilities
- It is a model that defines the defines the technologies in different locations/environments
- It is a model that defines the information assets that are consumed and produced by each Business Function/Service, including information exchange requirements with external business functions/services
- It is a model that defines the interaction (e.g. create, read, update, delete) between applications and data
- It is a model that defines the organisational structure (hierarchical decomposition), the functions/service performed by each organisational unit, the geographic location where these organisation unit reside, and the responsible authority (owner) of these organisation units
- It is a model that defines the relationships between objectives / imperatives as derived from Policy, Act, Regulation and requirements, and the responsible organisation to achieve the objectives, and the measures or key performance indicators (KPI) by which to measure achievements of such objectives
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Objects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that defines the security classification of Data Subjects and the roles in the organisation that need access thereto
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Business Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It is a model that indicates the deficiencies and opportunities for improvement that is derived from a comparison between the Baseline Data Architecture models and the Target Business Architecture models
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from a baseline to a target architecture state
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Application Architecture to the Target Application Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Data Architecture to the Target Data Architecture
- It outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progression from the Baseline Technology Architecture to the Target Technology Architecture
- It provides a model that defines the major classes of technology components/services (infrastructure software, hardware, and network) and the interoperability standards associated thereto

- The purpose of a Strategic Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to deliver the business and IT strategy of an enterprise
- The purpose of the
- The purpose of the Application Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Application elements that will exist at this stage of the Application Roadmap
- The purpose of the Application Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the major classes of applications that are needed to automate or enable the functions/services of
- The purpose of the Application Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Application Service Stakeholder Model is to inform stakeholders of the different roles (internal and external) that will interact with a given application service
- The purpose of the Business Function/Service Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Service Catalogue of an enterprise, the degree of automation of each function/service, and the roles (people) required to perform the function/service
- The purpose of the Business Information Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Data Subject classes that the enterprise must manage through its life-cycle
- The purpose of the Business Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing key business elements that will exist at this stage of the Business Roadmap
- The purpose of the Business Performance Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the performance accountability in an enterprise and the line of sight of an enterprise towards government strategic outcomes
- The purpose of the Business Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to business ekements of the enterprise that are to be undertaken to deliver the business strategy
- The purpose of the Data Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Information/Data elements that will exist at this stage of the Data Roadmap
- The purpose of the Data Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Data Security Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the security and responsibilities of the data assets in a department in order to improve data accountability
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between Data Subjects and applications in an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between logical Data Objects and application services in use across an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Information Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the information assets of an enterprise in a consistent manner that will enable re-use and information sharing
- The purpose of the Organisation Structure Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the accountability and responsibility towards the services that are routinely rendered by an enterprise â€“ be it an internal service or external service; and the business footprint to inform capacity and network design
- The purpose of the Strategic Goals Model is to provide stakeholders with a line of sight from high level strategic business goals, through objectives and the drivers that motivate them
- The purpose of the Technology Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Technology elements that will exist at this stage of the Technology Roadmap
- The purpose of the Technology Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of this view is to define the distribution of technology components for a distributed operating environment that will reduce duplication and optimise the re-use of shared infrastructure whilst providing optimal access channels to information intensive services to the intended users
- The purpose of this view is to describe the direct data related dependencies that exist for the
- The purpose of this view is to describe the flow of steps and participants (users and systems) in the
- The purpose of this view is to inform stakeholders on how applications or application components are distributed across the footprint of the organisation and how they interface or integrate with each other and the environment
- The purpose of this view is to inform stakeholders regarding the redundancies and deficiencies of technology in an enterprise
- The purpose of this view is to inform stakeholders regarding the workflow (and information flow) that is needed to produce a product or render a service.

- The purpose of a Strategic Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to deliver the business and IT strategy of an enterprise
- The purpose of a Strategic Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to deliver the business and IT strategy of an enterprise_2
- The purpose of gap analysis is to inform stakeholders regarding the extent of change that is required to move EA artifacts such as Services, Business Processes and Applications for the specified EA layer from a baseline state to a target state
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy
- The purpose of strategic roadmap is to inform stakeholders/decision-makers about the incremental changes that need to be undertaken to deliver the NCEI strategy. The roadmap outlines a list of individual increments of change over a timeline to show progress towards target architecture.

- The purpose of the Application Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Application elements that will exist at this stage of the Application Roadmap

- The purpose of the Application Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Application Service Stakeholder Model is to inform stakeholders of the different roles (internal and external) that will interact with a given application service
- The purpose of the Business Function/Service Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Service Catalogue of an enterprise, the degree of automation of each function/service, and the roles (people) required to perform the function/service
- The purpose of the Business Information Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the Data Subject classes that the enterprise must manage through its life-cycle
- The purpose of the Business Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing key business elements that will exist at this stage of the Business Roadmap
- The purpose of the Business Performance Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the performance accountability in an enterprise and the line of sight of an enterprise towards government strategic outcomes
- The purpose of the Business Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to business ekements of the enterprise that are to be undertaken to deliver the business strategy
- The purpose of the Data Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Information/Data elements that will exist at this stage of the Data Roadmap
- The purpose of the Data Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
- The purpose of the Data Security Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the security and responsibilities of the data assets in a department in order to improve data accountability
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between Data Subjects and applications in an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Data-to-Application Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the affinity (or relationship) between logical Data Objects and application services in use across an enterprise that is needed to inform the development, integration and deployment of software solutions
- The purpose of the Information Reference Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the information assets of an enterprise in a consistent manner that will enable re-use and information sharing
- The purpose of the Organisation Structure Model is to inform stakeholders regarding the accountability and responsibility towards the services that are routinely rendered by an enterprise â€“ be it an internal service or external service; and the business footprint to inform capacity and network design

- The purpose of the Service Dependency Model is to illustrate the dependencies that exist for a given Service
- The purpose of the Strategic Goals Model is to provide stakeholders with a line of sight from high level strategic business goals, through objectives and the drivers that motivate them
- The purpose of the Technology Milestone Summary View is to describe the Drivers and Objectives being supported as well as listing the Technology elements that will exist at this stage of the Technology Roadmap
- The purpose of the Technology Roadmap is to inform stakeholders regarding the incremental changes to be undertaken to address the deficiencies and redundancies as identified during gap analysis
